ContestIsEpic: The Contest is <1>Epic</1> - Heroes who enter the contest must mark Pathos
ContestIsMythic: The Contest is <1>Mythic</1> - Heroes who enter the contest must spend Divine Favour
ContestIsPerilous: The Contest is <1>Perilous</1> - Heroes who suffer must mark Pathos
ContestIsSacred: The Contest is <1>Sacred</1> - Heroes who suffer must spend Divine Favour
AboutCreatedBy: This app was created by <1>@gareth</1> and <3>@sporgory</3> with the help of the <5>AGON fan Discord community.</5>
AboutFeedback: If you'd like to give feedback or get involved, check out the <1>GitHub repo.</1>
AboutAgon: This is a fan-made dice-rolling app for AGON. AGON is an action-packed roleplaying game about epic Heroes who face trials from the Gods in an ancient world of myth and legend. Learn more about it, and the Paragon system, at <1>agon-rpg.com</1>
AboutRules: At least one person playing should be familiar with the AGON rulebook.
AboutApp: This app is a lightweight dicerolling app, focused on resolving and narrating AGON Contests. It is not a campaign or character tracker - you'll still need to manage that on your own.
A record of how the Heroes fared in the: A record of how the Heroes fared in the Contest. Heroes should narrate their results in ascending order - the Strife player should respond with the Opponents reactions.
This is the challenge that the Heroes mu: This is the challenge that the Heroes must strive to overcome.
You are a glorious Hero - strive to take: You are a glorious Hero - strive to take on worthy opponents. If a challenge isn't glorious, you can accomplish it without need for a Contest.
Waiting for the next Glorious Contest: Waiting for the next Glorious Contest
Create a contest whenever the heroes com: Create a contest whenever the heroes come into conflict with a worthy opponent.
Adjust the strife level for permanent or: Adjust the strife level for permanent or temporary advantages or disadvantages.
Add dice for the Opponent's Name, Epithe: Add dice for the Opponent's Name, Epithets, and any Bonus dice.
ChooseSacredHarm: <1>Sacred</1> - Heroes spend Divine Favor if they suffer in the Contest.
ChoosePerilousHarm: <1>Perilous</1> - Heroes mark Pathos if they suffer in the Contest.
ChooseMythicHarm: <1>Mythic</1> - Heroes spend Divine Favor to enter the Contest.
ChooseEpicHarm: <1>Epic</1> - Heroes mark Pathos to enter the Contest.
Each Hero Player indicates their partici: Each Hero Player indicates their participation in the contest by speaking their name. Start with the leader and go around the table. On your turn, recite your hero's name and add dice as you go: If your Epithet applies to the contest, add that die. Add your Name die and the Domain die for the contest when you say your Name and lineage.
Heroes join the contest by building thei: Heroes join the contest by building their dice pool. Make sure everyone is ready before rolling the final results!
Are you Strife or a Hero?: Are you Strife or a Hero?
Every game of AGON needs one Strife play: Every game of AGON needs one Strife player and at least two Hero Players.
The Strife player challenges the Heroes: The Strife player challenges the Heroes with worthy Contests.
Hero players contend against the Contest: Hero players contend against the Contests presented by the Strife player.
AboutAgonDiceRoller: This is a fan-made dice-rolling app for AGON. AGON is an action-packed roleplaying game about epic Heroes who face trials from the Gods in an ancient world of myth and legend. Learn more about it, and the Paragon system, at <1>agon-rpg.com</1>
Start a new session. You'll be able to i: Start a new session. You'll be able to invite other players with a unique URL.
Paste it below or in your browser and cl: Paste it below or in your browser and click Join Game.
Cannot set ready unless at least two dic: Cannot set ready unless at least two dice (d6-d12) are included in the dice pool
All players must be ready before contest: All players must be ready before contest can be rolled
